questions.question: Where do the IEPDs come from?
questions.answer: These IEPDs have been built by the NIEM community for use in real-world exchanges.  Many of these IEPDs have been loaded from a few older IEPD repositories which are no longer being maintained.  Their content has not been changed.

questions.question: Are the IEPDs conformant?
questions.answer: Historically, IEPD repositiories have not required validation before an IEPD could be submitted. Integrating conformance validation into this tool is a planned feature for the future.  Users should review any IEPD they wish to leverage from this tool.

questions.question: Where can I learn more about IEPDs?
questions.answer: Please see the NIEM Training for more information about IEPDs.

questions.question: What does the IEPD tool search?
questions.answer:
The IEPD tool searches through metadata for the IEPDs, registries, and repositories that have been posted to it.

  1. IEPD Metadata
    For IEPDs, this metadata comes from the either 'metadata.xml' (for IEPDs based on the MPD 1.0 specification) or 'mpd-catalog.xml' (for IEPDs based the MPD 3.0 specification).

  2. Registry / Repository Metadata
    For external IEPD registries and repositories, only the metadata that the contributor logs into the tool is searched - follow the external link if an external registry or repository looks promising for a more detailed search.

questions.question: I don't have a repository.  Can I post my IEPD here?
questions.answer: Yes, you will be able to post your full IEPD here.  It will be saved to the public GitHub repository on which this website is based.

questions.question: I have my own repository.  Can I register my IEPD here?
questions.answer: Yes, you will be able to register your IEPD here.  You will need to upload your IEPD metadata file (metadata.xml or mpd-catalog.xml).  It will be saved to the public GitHub repository on which this website is based.  Your metadata file should include a URL so users can follow search hits back to your published IEPD.

questions.question: How do I check if my IEPD is conformant?
questions.answer: For an IEPD based on NIEM 3.0 or a later release, upload your IEPD to ConTesA (The Conformance Testing Assistant)

questions.question: IEPD checklist before submitting
questions.answer:
This is not a complete list, but some common tips are provided below to help you review an IEPD before submitting it:

  1. Check extension schemas for conformance targets
    All extension schemas should have a conformance target that identifies which version and rule set of the NDR are being followed. Conformance testing is not run on schemas that do not have a conformance target. See Conformance Targets for more information.

  2. XML schema Validation
    Using a XML tool like Oxygen, XMLSpy, or Xerces, check all schemas for validation errors.

  3. NDR conformance validation
    Upload your IEPD zip file to ConTesA to check your XML extension schemas against the NDR rules.

  4. Review your IEPD artifacts
    ConTesA only checks schemas against NDR rules. It will be necessary to manually review your IEPD package.

    It's useful to make sure that the mpd-catalog.xml has descriptive information about your exchange (), that there are helpful sample instances that show what a realistic message might look like, and that any necessary supporting documentation is included.

    This package should be self-contained, providing implementers with the information that they need to use the IEPD.

    See the MPD Specification, including Appendix E. Guidance for IEPD Directories (non-normative) for more information on what an IEPD should contain and how it should be structured.
